children.name: a competition in sports or games
competition
children.definition: an organizedeventin which people try to do anactivityorsportbetter than other people, especially in order to win a prize: cuộc thi
examples: a photography competition
competition to do something
a competition to find a designer for the new building

children.name: take part in a competition
examples: Ten schools took part in the competition.

children.name: enter a competition
examples: You must be over 16 to enter the competition.

children.name: win a competition
examples: Lucy was thrilled to hear that she had won the short-story competition.

children.name: come first/second/third etc in a competition
examples: Stuart came second in the swimming competition.

children.name: have/hold a competition
examples: Each year the school holds a painting competition.

children.name: run a competition
children.definition: organize it
examples: The company is running an inventions competition with a first prize of £1,000.

children.name: launch a competition
children.definition: start it
examples: We’re launching a competition to find the best young designer.

children.name: judge a competition
children.definition: decide who has won it
examples: A panel of five will judge the competition.

children.name: withdraw from a competition
children.definition: not take part, when you had planned to
examples: He had to withdraw from the competition because of an injury.

children.name: be out of a competition
children.definition: no longer be in a competition because you have been defeated
examples: Our team scored the fewest points so we were out of the competition.

children.name: put/knock sb out of a competition
children.definition: defeat someone so that they are no longer in a competition
examples: They put us out of the competition in the semi-final last year.

children.name: a football/music/essay etc competition
examples: There’s a music competition in the town on June 12th.

children.name: a writing/painting/dancing etc competition
examples: Greg won the school public-speaking competition.

children.name: a sporting/sports competition
examples: There is an increasing demand to watch sporting competitions.

children.name: a national/international/
examples: European etc competitionHer oldest daughter has taken part in national competitions.

children.name: an annual competition
examples: Last year he won the magazine’s annual photo competition.

children.name: an open competition
children.definition: that everyone can take part in
examples: An open competition is to be held at the tennis club.

children.name: a knock-out competitionUK
children.definition: in which if you lose a game, you are no longer in the competition

children.name: a newspaper competition
children.definition: organized by and advertised in a newspaper
examples: I entered a newspaper competition for young photographer of the year.

children.name: the result of a competition
examples: The result of the competition will be announced on April 3rd.

children.name: the winner of a competition
examples: Jane was the clear winner of the competition.

children.name: the rules of a competition
examples: Make sure you understand the rules of the competition.

children.name: a competition is open to sb
children.definition: used to say who can enter a competition
examples: The competition is open to artists between 16 and 25 years old.

children.name: contest
children.definition: a competition in which a person or team does an activity, and a group of judges decide which of them is the best: cuộc thi (ban giám khảo)
examples: It is clear that the election will be aclose contest.
contest for
the bitter contest for the Republican presidential nomination
contest between/against
the 1960 contest between Kennedy and Nixon
the 1975 Liberalleadership contest
enter sb in/for a contest
Harriet decided to enter Henry in the cute baby contest.
a presidential contestthe 1987 U.S presidential contest

children.name: enter a contest
children.definition: take part in one
examples: Anyone over 18 years old can enter the contest.

children.name: take part in a contest
examples: Twenty-five countries took part in the contest.

children.name: compete in a contest
examples: The band has competed in many contests over the years.

children.name: win/lose a contest
examples: He won a public-speaking contest at his school.

children.name: withdraw from a contest
children.definition: stop taking part in a contest
examples: Two candidates had withdrawn from the contest.

children.name: have/hold a contest
examples: My college holds an athletics contest once a year.

children.name: a contest takes place
examples: The contest took place in Berlin.

children.name: a leadership contest
children.definition: in which two politicians compete to become leader of their party
examples: The party did not want the turmoil of a leadership contest.

children.name: an electoral/election contest
examples: What will be the outcome of the electoral contest?

children.name: a beauty contest
children.definition: to find the most beautiful person
examples: Miss Colombia won the beauty contest.

children.name: a talent contest
children.definition: to find the best performer
examples: She's singing a song in the school talent contest.

children.name: a popularity contest
children.definition: to decide which person people like the most
examples: The competition has turned into a popluarity contest.

children.name: close
children.definition: one which someone wins by a very small amount
examples: The race was a close contest between two evenly matched crews.

children.name: fair
children.definition: one in which everyone has the same chance of winning
examples: Divide the class into groups in a way that will make it a fair contest.

children.name: even/equalBritish English
children.definition: one in which everyone has the same chance of winning
examples: One of the men was much older so it was hardly an even contest.

children.name: uneven/unequalBritish English
children.definition: one in which one of the people, groups etc has a better chance of winning
examples: Given their military strength, the war was a pretty unequal contest.

children.name: quiz
children.definition: a competition or game in which people have to answer questions: cuộc thivấn đáp
examples: a love quiz in a magazine
a history/sport, etc. quiz
ageneral knowledge quiz
quiz showespecially British English:
There are so many inane television quizshows.
I get fed up with television quiz shows.
quiz nightBritish English:
a quiz night held in the local pub
A lot of pubs have quiznightsonce or twice a week.

children.name: race
children.definition: a competition in which people or animals compete to run, drive etc fastest and finish first: cuộc đua
examples: in a race
He will be the youngest runner in the race.
Over 80 cars will take part in the race.
race between
the annual boat race between Oxford and Cambridge Universities
qualify for a raceto have run, driven etc fast enough to take part in a particular race
Krystal has already qualified for the hundred-metre race in the Olympics next year.

children.name: tough/hard
examples: He said he expected the race to be tough.

children.name: the big race
children.definition: an important race
examples: There are only three days to go until the big race.

children.name: a 3000 metres/10 km etc race
examples: He finished first in the 100 metres race.

children.name: a horse/boat/bike etc race
examples: It’s legal to gamble on horse races.

children.name: a road race
children.definition: when people run, cycle etc on ordinary roads
examples: She regularly competes in 10 kilometre road races.

children.name: compete in a race
children.definition: alsotake part in a race
examples: He is competing in his first race this year.|Runners from all over the world will take part in the race.

children.name: have a race
examples: Let’s have a race!

children.name: hold a race
examples: The race will be held on February 25th.

children.name: win/lose a race
examples: He did not win another race that season.

children.name: come first/last etc in a race
children.definition: alsofinish first/last etc in a race
examples: She came third in the race.

children.name: lead the race
children.definition: be ahead of everyone else
examples: He led the race from start to finish.

children.name: finish the race
examples: Congratulations to Matthew, who finished the race in three hours 17 minutes.

children.name: run a race
examples: I thought I ran a good race.

children.name: enter sb/sth in a race
examples: The horse is entered in a race at Worcester the day after tomorrow.

children.name: away
children.definition: an away match or game is played at an opposing team's sports ground
examples: We lost the awaygamebut won both the home games.

children.name: head-to-head
children.definition: involving a direct competition between two people or teams:
examples: a head-to-head contest

children.name: be/ play at home
children.definition: if a sports team are or play at home, they play on their own sports field.

children.name: home
children.definition: played or playing at a team’s own sports field, rather than an opponent’s field
examples: home team/game/crowd/club etc
The home team took the lead after 25 minutes.
the home team/side
a home match

children.name: season
children.definition: the period of the year during which a particular sport is played: mùa giải
examples: The British football season begins in August and ends in May.

children.name: end-of-season
children.definition: describes a sports event which happens at the end of a season (=the part of a year in which a sport is played): cuối mùa giải
examples: the end-of-seasonplay-offs

children.name: postseason
children.definition: describes games that are played after the end of the sports season: sau mùa giải
examples: TheGardenState Bowl kicks off the postseason college football games.

children.name: preseason
children.definition: pre-seasonUKUS  in sports, happening before the main period of competition: trước mùa giải
examples: pre-seasonUKpreseasonUS [C usually S] in sports, a short period of competition before the main period
Barkley suffered a strained thigh muscle late in the preseason.
David Beckham had a great pre-season.

children.name: a pre-season match/game
examples: Manchester United and Arsenal were the pre-season favourites.

children.name: tournament
children.definition: a competition in a sport or game, in which many players or teams compete against each other until there is one winner: giải thi đấu
examples: I feel I can win this tournament.
tennis/chess/badminton etc tournament
an international golf tournament
There’s a volleyball tournament at Sunset Park which begins today.
win a tournament
Telford won the local five-a-side football tournament.
round of the tournament
They were defeated in the firstround ofthe tournament.

children.name: championship
children.definition: an important sports competition to find the best player or team in the world or in a particular area: giải vô địch
examples: the women’s figure skating championships
Greece won the European Championship.
the state/national/world etc championship29 nations competed in the world championship. the Canadian National Championship
a golf/swimming/tennis championshipthe Women's Golf Championship

children.name: the
examples: British/European etc championshipThe team failed to qualify for the European Championship.

children.name: an international championship
examples: It was the final game of the international championship.

children.name: the League championship
children.definition: for a particular group of teams or players
examples: the Football League Championship

children.name: win/take the championship
examples: He won three national championships at Oklahoma.

children.name: lose the championship
examples: We lost the championship on the last day.

children.name: hold the championship
examples: The championships are being held next Sunday at the San Jose Arena.

children.name: a championship takes place
examples: The world indoor athletics championships took place in Canada.

children.name: a championship game/match
examples: He was playing in his first championship game of the season.

children.name: a championship race
examples: She was well ahead in the championship race.

children.name: a championship series
children.definition: a number of competitions
examples: the American League Championship series

children.name: the championship finals
examples: His team lost in the European Championship Finals.

children.name: a championship title
children.definition: the position of being the champion in a sports competition
examples: He's trying to hold onto his world championship title.

children.name: knockout
children.definition: / elimination tournamentUS a type of competition in which only the winning players or teams at each stage continue to play until there is only one winner: đấu loại trực tiếp
examples: The tournament is a straight knockout.
knockout[adj]informalrelating to a type of competition in which only the winning players or teams at each stage continue to play :
Scotland’s failure to get through the knockout stage of the competition
a knockout competition/championship/match

children.name: ladder
children.definition: / ladder tournament mainly UK (in particular sports) a system in which all the players who play regularly are given a position in a list and can improve their position by beating other players in that list
examples: a squash ladder

children.name: event
children.definition: a match or competition, especially one that is important and is attended by a lot of people: sự kiện
examples: Tomorrow’s match against Portugal is expected to be the big event of the season.

children.name: sporting event
examples: John rarely misses a sporting event in his town.
Wimbledon is one of Britain’s great sporting events.

children.name: Games
children.definition: an large organized sports event
examples: the Olympic/ Commonwealth Games

children.name: time
children.definition: nounRACE thời gian hoàn thành

children.name: fixture
children.definition: nounSPORTS EVENT ngày thi đấu, thời gian thi đấu

children.name: UKa day and usually a time agreed for a sports event
examples: _Next season's fixtures will be published early next month.
